title: 111_hr2891
content: The "Access to Frontline Health Care Act of 2009" includes a Frontline Providers Loan Repayment Program under Subpart XI of the Public Health Service Act. The Secretary will establish a Frontline Providers Loan Repayment Program where individuals agree to serve as health professionals for at least 2 years in a healthcare facility in a scarcity area in exchange for student loan repayments. To be eligible, individuals must submit an application and sign a contract with the Secretary. Participants are approved upon the Secretary's decision. The Loan Repayment Program requires individuals to submit an application and sign a contract with the Secretary for approval. Preference is given to applicants with interdisciplinary training. The Secretary determines scarcity areas for placement, prioritizing those with interdisciplinary healthcare programs or plans. The Secretary gives preference to areas with interdisciplinary health care programs or plans for loan repayment approval. Individuals receive written notice upon approval for participation in the program. The contract includes agreements for student loan repayment for a specified period. The contract includes provisions for student loan repayment for a specified period, contingent on funds being appropriated. It also outlines damages the United States is entitled to for breach of the contract. The contract includes provisions for student loan repayment, determination of repayment amount by the Secretary, and payments directly to loan providers. It also outlines damages for breach of contract. The contract involves student loan repayment on behalf of individuals, with provisions for payment directly to loan providers. Breach of contract incurs penalties equal to the total paid amount and interest. Definitions include 'frontline care scarcity area' as designated by health professional shortage areas or states with frontline care service shortages. The curr_chunk defines 'frontline care services' as health care services in various fields provided by specific healthcare professionals in designated shortage areas. The curr_chunk outlines the authorized appropriations for carrying out frontline care services, including funding amounts for fiscal years 2010 to 2015 and subsequent years based on percentage increases. For fiscal year 2015, $153,000,000 is appropriated, with subsequent years adjusted based on the average percentage increase in health professions education costs. The Secretary must start implementing the loan repayment program within 180 days of enactment.
